Pros: Excellent supportive manager. Fantastic team to work with. Everyone was willing to help one another.
Cons: Unexpected company wide layoff affected my job.

Pros: Learned a great deal on my journey with Acronis. Good if you want to learn the basics of Cybersecurity. Great if you want to be part of a global company, where everyone runs around like a chick with the head cut off. I loved Acronis from afar for several years. I was thrilled to become part of the team, and imagine how completely let down I felt, when I realized what Acronis really was. Excellent benefits and PTO Working remotely was wonderful. Best engineers you will find.
Cons: I really think there are too many to list, but I will try: -Please NOTE- Patrick is NOT the CEO and has not been for a bit. -Pay is very much below industry average. You are not paid near what your experience is worth. Lowest in the industry by far. -Upper management always fibs, and has no loyalty to their direct reports. -HR and upper level execs are in league, so if you ever need anything, or need to report something that is affecting you, nothing will be done, and you will be reprimanded for speaking up. -Company grew way too fast in the last year, making up role titles, and hiring people off the street to fill these roles, only for it all to end badly. They are trying to "puff up" to look good for a sale or going public. -You are forced to sign a new KPI/ Sales quota/ target attainment agreement each quarter. Sometimes twice a quarter. -Commissions are capped. -You do not get your "bonus/ comm" for weeks, sometimes months, after the end of a quarter. -Despite what has been circulated, Acronis is a Russian company, with Russian founders and owners, period. -New CEO, 3 days in, company wide layoff's. -Acronis blows money on things that are NOT needed and not profitable, instead of investing in Acronis and its employees. -Acronis' mission statement is NOT partner aligned or focused at all. -Acronis will not invest in a stateside support team, and this has caused a huge rift with partners. They can not get support on the line when they need it, as it is all across seas. The support team is lazy, and even when directed to call a partner, they will not. They continue to email and send video's and KB articles. Not a professional means of communication or assistance to partner's at all.

Pros:
*Full-time work-from-home
*agile env 
*nice people
Cons: - There is no transparency

Pros: Great product that does a great job servicing the MSP community with tools to support and protect their customers, while providing ample opportunities for revenue growth.
Cons: USA vs. Russia. Those who work at Acronis will know exactly what this means. There are duplicitous positions throughout the organization that battle non-stop. For example, there is a V.P. of Sales for America and a Chief Sales Strategist position occupied by a Russian employee. Their messaging and support often do not align and if you get caught in between the two parties you are screwed. I reported up through Russian management and all of my accounts were managed by U.S. sales leaders. The chips were stacked against me from the get go.

Review Title: Great culture, Acronis makes working fun

Cons: I havent anything to share that is derogatory.

Pros: Experience, learning ins and out of cyber security, some great co-workers, Insurance is wonderful. Time off and work life balance are great. Acronis has some wonderful ideas, just no real plan to get there that will work, and be successful.
Cons: Pay is very below par. Commission are not commissions, there is no real OTE because it's always the same #. 1-2 new comm or bonus structure changes to sign every quarter, no real desire to help MSP's, just trying to make money. No stateside support to assist the MSP's.

Pros: Great people and good benefits
Cons: Not sure, great company overall

Pros: Unlimited PTO, Remote work, Travel
Cons:
Where do I start? The 1am meetings followed by 7am meetings the following day seem a good place. This is a global company without regional division, which means you will be expected to work around the clock. You will have to sleep during the day to get any sleep at all. 

Executive management is concerned only with growth, even if at the expense of employee health, and without regard to feasibility. Despite being told "no," sales will promise moon to earn and keep business (which is difficult sometimes), and you will be forced to work your knuckles to the bone to make it happen. When it fails, as you said it would, you will still take heat because leadership does not stand up for its employees. 

There is no clear vision, no process. Hope you enjoy spending 4-8 hours a week doing nothing but PowerPoint, because it seems to be the only way information is communicated. Documentation isn't kept, let alone read.

There is no such thing as work life balance here. You will be subject to meetings at every hour of the day. Say no? You're not a team player. 

Hiring practices are in utter disarray, as the criminally understaffed HR cannot get a job offer to a candidate in time for them to accept it. By the time one goes out, they've likely moved on. 

Red. Tape. Everywhere. Purchasing decisions must go through 8 levels of approval to be made. This is not an exaggeration.

Run.

lots of support and involvement. constant change which keeps things interesting.
benefits good
They take care of you here
Cons: not too many. Runs a bit like start up but over all great company

Pros: Great environment with a hybrid flexible work schedules.

Pros: Having a job and a measly paycheck.
Cons: Everything. This place is a mess. Covid or not, this company doesn't know how to treat people. Employees are merely a number here. Either meet unreasonable expectations or kill yourself trying. Company culture/philosophies are backward and offensive. Don't believe anything about a bonus. If you are desperate enough to accept a position here, get details about the bonus you won't be getting and so you can ask about it every quarter why you didn't get it. Pay is low for their expectations. Seriously, headquarters in Switzerland and Singapore? You'll quickly understand what folks run this company and from where. The headquarters are just a smoke screen for the real culture behind the company. As for "Cyber Protection", good luck with that. They have some decent ideas but of course execution is lacking and they're too busy with bells and whistles than actual substance. When long time staff states that they would never recommend working here on a channel that includes top "C" officials and nothing is done about it, you know you should stay away.

Pros: good benefits, great people, office is new
Cons: growth pains, turn over is too high

Pros:
Acronis is a perfect place to take your career to the next level, gain global experience and learn the market. 
If you are looking to develop yourself and learn new things -  this is the best place.  It's so easy to make an impact and all the results are visible because everything is so transparent. Competence and excellence are recognized and rewarded.
 
It's not about who you know or what team you're working for — if you do amazing things here, it will be seen and acknowledged. It doesn't matter whom you report to, what level you are, or when you started here – if you are consistent, responsive, willing to help, and do your job well, you will thrive.
 
Personally, Acronis was a perfect match for my character. I like how management is not afraid to change things up and try new things. The company is moving fast and executives are never bored. Having the ability to make decisions and take responsibility for them was really refreshing compared to my previous companies.  Mistakes can be made in such a fast pace, so you have to be able to acknowledge, fix it and move on. 
There are no limits to what you can do here –   you are able to do what you can and want, which moves you closer to the edge of your capabilities and constantly pushes your boundaries. It is a great place to learn business strategy and participate in decision making that has material impact.
Cons: Because of the speed, there are frequent changes in org structure. This can actually help you grow, which is what happened with me personally.  But not everyone can survive and work under such pressure.

Pros: Everybody seems very hardworking and motivated in Acronis. Good energy, interesting projects.
Cons: Unusual corporate culture, partially because there were a lot of Russian managers. For example, nobody introduced new teammates during the Zoom calls.

Pros: So much to learn and many cool connections made
Cons: Big company so things take a lot of time and can get lost in the craziness

Pros:
There is a lot of growth potential here at Acronis. It doesn't happen overnight, but many of those who continue to work hard and deliver results are given more responsibilities and opportunities.
Each position has an individual contributor aspect (even at higher levels) which means you must be hands on and willing to do a lot of work yourself. Due to the size and nature of the company, most roles cover multiple areas of their department and business. This gives you more ownership of the work, career growth, and development. It also means you can see the impact of your work and know that you were the person who delivered (or helped) those results. 
Another plus is that Acronis is worldwide, which allows you to work with different people, cultures, and regions. 
In all, Acronis has given me so much over the last 3 + years - a career, a family, long lasting relationships, and unforgettable memories.
Cons:
Acronis is not for everyone because it is a fast-paced environment with higher than average workloads and responsibilities. There also have been some changes in management that have caused a little turbulence throughout the years here. But if you can manage the changes, fast pace and heavy workload, Acronis will benefit you so much. 
The work can be challenging and stressful, but nothing worthwhile is ever easy :-)

Review Title: Do your research before joining the company.
Pros:
There are some great people that work for Acronis - when I first started working here I loved it. Everyone was so friendly, encouraging and helpful. I never had an issue approaching upper management for help or even to say hello. The company used to foster those kinds of relationships.

The software is also incredible. The product should be so easy to sell!
Cons:
The CEO has spent way too much money on F1 marketing to keep up with other Russian software companies - and the employees are paying for it. The pay is below average salaries in the area. A handful of managers and VP level people have been let go and we no longer have company get-togethers to foster those "team building" relationships. 

We don't have 401k matching and the mood in the Burlington office is much more somber, but at least we have formula 1 racing cars with brand new Playstations that no one plays.

Review Title: Great team environment but Employer has issues
Pros: Fun team environment, great snacks, nice office
Cons: Questionable comp plans, different local management views versus senior management that is outside of US

Review Title: Great exposure to a global environment
Pros:
I have been working at Acronis for a littler over a year now. I have worked for startups and a competitor prior, and can proudly say, "I love my job."

Here are few reasons I enjoy my time here:

- Diversity & the people: companies often tout how diverse their workplace is, but often they "try hard" to hire diverse groups of people. At Acronis, it comes naturally - you get to meet people from all around the world and continuously learn from one another.

- Fast-paced environment: you'll never get bored as things are always changing, but that doesn't mean we don't have fun along the way.

- Your opinion matters: It doesn't matter what position or level you're in - your opinion will matter when it comes to projects - you're on a team!

- And some other superficial things in the office: pool tables, snacks, unlimited caffeine by Boston Coffee Company...
Cons: We're a growing company with some growing pains (with our [legacy] systems). But afterall, this is why they hire people to join the team, to solve these pain points and move the company forward in the right direction.

Pros:
I have been with Acronis for almost 8 years and worked outside different offices located on three different continents.  Our Acronis global Team is very diverse, we have 18 offices across the global, with varieties of cultures and nationalities. Understanding cultural differences helps overcome communication challenges at work. Currently, my team works across all time zones including Grater Boston Area, Munich, Moscow, Singapore, Tokyo, Sydney. As I am in a global role, I have to stay connected with my peers and be able to support their business needs. I value that global experience, as it provides me with understandings of how different markets operate.

The other great part is a technology side. We are early adopters of cutting-edge technologies. I am getting invaluable and sometimes unique experience that increases my tech skills. I am getting deep understanding in products and technologies we develop. 

Last but not least, is a fun part. We try to keep our offices connected through our social media channels by sharing their team and individual pictures with hashtag #AcronisPeople on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook. I am keen to know, what is a life looks like in our other offices. That is a fun part, but very important to keep global team connected.
Cons: Life-time balance sometimes is hard to active due to projects and different times zones.

Review Title: Great Opportunities, Great Benefits, Great People
Pros: Acronis is a great place for career growth and development. During my time, I've had the opportunity to work in different departments. It's a great place to work and has helped me understand company structure and the business side of things, which in my opinion, is great exposure to help carry on in any future position. While I love my position, the great healthcare benefits, and the perks/incentives (we have snacks in the kitchen, F1 gaming simulators and a Foosball table - come on!), the people are what make this Company outstanding. They surprised me with a Bridal Shower right before my wedding, sent flowers to the funeral home when my family member passed away and continuously show appreciation for my efforts. The healthcare benefits are also really great and they truly care about what employees would like to see (for example, they now offer a 401(k) match after many inquiries). With a pre-existing condition and having numerous medical appointments, I've never been more thankful and appreciative for the insurance coverage Acronis has to offer. Overall, I'd recommend this Company without a doubt.
Cons: Internal systems could be better - as with any global company, it can be hard to find systems that have the capability to function globally; but it is something they are working on

Review Title: A great place to work and develop your career
Pros:
Working with cutting edge solutions on exciting and thrilling projects. Leadership that is hardworking and that cares about the development of those who report into them. The ability to evolve and grow your career in a way that suits your talents. 

Hard work and effort definitely pay off. A majority of the organization goes above and beyond.

Most teams have great synergy, with support and collaboration being a key driver to the current successes
Cons:
Work/Life balance can be a challenge. 

There is a slight disconnect at the upper organizational management level on how business should be managed (it's more like too many cooks in the kitchen, with some cooks not knowing how to work with the ingredients they have to make a recipe that works ) 

Internal processes in place are not always well refined.

Pros: Very hands-on work environment which gives you opportunities for career growth. I have been able to grow here at Acronis more than I have anywhere else. I like that everyone's work has an impact on the success of the company, and the company vision has a positive impact on the world and society. Most of the people who work here have a good sense of humor and are fun to be around. And I love that it is on the more casual side of business casual.
Cons: Acronis is not a fit for everyone. Every position is important, so it is not a place where you can just cruise by doing the bare minimum. There are definitely some challenges to overcome and areas for improvement, but that is expected for a tech company like this. In order to be successful here, you have to work through challenges and focus on the solution. We either make ourselves miserable or we make ourselves strong - the amount of work is the same.

Pros: Small company with distributed workforce giving flexibility to work where you want.
Cons: Horrible culture and very disorganized. Barely any decent talent.

Pros: The company is at the period of an epic transformation, transitioning from traditional software distribution model to cloud services model. Management is not afraid of trying new things and making unusual moves to achieve fast growth. Great time for experiments and gaining new experience. Incredible opportunity to try something extraordinary.
Cons: Entrepreneurial culture of the company puts a lot of pressure on employees. Senior executives work 24/7 and demand the same from the employees. Not everyone can keep up with the rhythm. This is not a company for people who want to have a boring job – continual learning is required, agility and ability to implement new ideas is a must.

Pros:
Acronis takes care of the employees.
Kitchen stocked with free treats for employees (at least in the US office), regular company events and celebrations, as well as cool swag - all these little things add up and show that management wants to reward and motivate the staff.
On a more important note, Acronis really values hard working and dedicated employees. I have seen (and experienced) fast career growth and real acknowledgement of contributions. You will be rewarded and noticed if you work hard and smart.
Cons:
You have to be dedicated to the company.
Acronis has a startup mentality, that everybody has to be passionate about the company and really care. This is not the place for the kind of people who work 9-5 - you have to breathe and live Acronis. While it is not a con for me, it may be for a lot of people.

Pros: I can't think of any.  It has been a roller coaster since I started.  So many different managers, and a lay off when they say they want to grow.
Cons:
* Management doesn't listen
* Management doesn't communicate changes that are made
* Management talks down to their employees.  They say "my business" when it's actually "our business" we are all trying to reach a number.
* turnover is at an all time high.  I've seen three general managers over the course of 2 years.
* They are bringing in several people from other countries to "manage" but they don't understand how business in the US works.
* When people leave the refuse to pay their vacation time.
* HR won't respond when there are issues.  And when you need an immediate response they blow you off.
* Very shady business practices.  Discounting for one not for another.  Accounts stolen by other account managers.  Management has no control over their business.
* lots of pressure from upper management to commit to a number without having the data or resources to figure out the data.
* They have hired several new "leaders" that don't understand the business.  They don't understand how things work and they don't give effective training.
* The latest version of the product has not worked for several customers and the refuse to do any RMAs for these issues.

Review Title: Lots of Diversity, Great Global Company
Pros:
I have been with the company over 12 years and have always been treated with respect. The people around me have always and currently are great to work with. I have the pleasure of interacting with many different people within the company on a global level. 

The time zone differences can be a challenge but working with the different people have been very fruitful and enjoyable. But getting to know and work closely with this diverse culture is a real pleasure. 

 401K match was added which is a definite pro. :)

 The fact that my work and efforts are appreciated.
Cons:
Communication needs improvement (but I think this is an issue at most places)

Old Systems that have not been put to bed holds back efficiency and progress in some areas. These need to be integrated to our newer systems for a more fluid current centralized processing machine!

Review Title: Rudderless, very Dysfunctional  – just a job not a career
Pros: Worked with some talented likeable coworkers.  Company's software products pretty good, some won awards.  Free snacks & beverages, and lunches catered sometimes
Cons: Really inept executive team, many in titles and roles far beyond their training and experience - their in way over their heads and it showed daily.  Ineffective absentee CEO.  No clear strategy, goals, roles, review process and poor mgmt communication.  Culture of secrecy; place founded by Russians and many decisions still made in Moscow by founders & their cronys or behind closed doors by exec team.  Awful , depressing work environment, lots of demands but little support – senior mgmt quick to blame others but never take reponsibilty for how their own actions (or inaction) and bad decisions effect entire org.  Mgmt shows no desire to develop or keep employees, people viewed as easily replaced.  Thus limited possiblity for career growth or financial gain, esp. for sales since products sold mainly thru partners.  Benefits suck compared 2 other co.’s (lower pay, no 401K match, less vacation days, etc.).  Morale very low.  Wish I left a lot sooner than I did, much happier now.

Review Title: It's not a job, its an adventure.
Pros: Exposure to people across the globe.   A never ending set of new challenges and new learning experiences.  The people in Burlington are pretty nice and are from all around the world.  The senior executives work harder than everyone else, and the CEO works harder than they do.  His commitment to the company is unquestionable.  Everyone is constantly challenged to do their best, and then to outdo themselves.
Cons: There is no question that people at Acronis work hard, but Acronis is very upfront about that when interviewing.  Once the choice is made to accept that challenge, there's no place for complaining about it.  I gave an overall 5 star rating because my job is really interesting.  Like everyone else in life, I would like more money and more time off.

Review Title: Company cannot get out of its own way
Pros:
*Solid technology
*Newfound commitment to marketing
*Decent salary
*Leadership really pushing to build $1B company
*Great opportunity in cloud marketplace for data protection
Cons:
*Constant changes at leadership level
*Way too many 'cooks in the kitchen', the organization is way too top heavy
*Sales Compensation plans are capped and are not designed to drive the right business behaviors
*Company is trying to do too many things at once
*No room for growth

Review Title: Good place to build a career
Pros:
Always had the best toys to play with, always had a chance to explore a technology i'm interested in. 
Acronis relocated me from Moscow and took care of all paperwork and expenses and i'll be always grateful for that. 
You can find as many bright people to talk to as you want.
There is always an opportunity to step up on your career path and take interesting projects or show some initiative.
Cons: There are always some people that you "don't agree" with but i never had a chance to work in the company that didn't have such people.

Review Title: Long time employee - still growing and moving up the ladder
Pros: It's a land of opportunity for those willing to push themselves beyond their limits.   I have never encountered a ceiling here and my hard work, dedication and loyalty have been consistently rewarded with promotions and significant increases in pay.
Cons: The environment can get intense sometimes, especially with fluctuations in the global economy that impacts all businesses.   There have been years of management turnover, but senior management has stabilized as the leaders in place now have been there in average for at least 3 years.

Review Title: A highly innovative technology company with bright future and lots of opportunity for professional growth.
Pros: Well-established, profitable fast growing global business operating in hot markets of Backup/DR and Mobility. Strong highly competitive products. Good benefits for employees. Continued professional growth for those who want to work hard. Lots of positive change in the last 6 months since the original founder came back on board as CEO.
Cons: Some minor troubles with overall direction for the business and subsequent change in Senior Management that occurred in the last 2 years. This resulted in uncertainty for some employees and probably some bad reviews, but has since been resolved completely. The business and internal culture are back on track and the future is looking very good.

Pros: There are and have been some good people here at Acronis. Unfortunately, they either don't last or aren't allowed to effectively do their jobs. The technology is valuable and the products good. The product lines are confusing to work through but are good. If compensation is your only goal and you can "work" your way into the "inner circle" this company drastically overpays.
Cons: This is easily the most mismanaged company I have ever come across. The lack of effective leadership and accountability is extraordinary. The phrase "top heavy" describes Acronis. However, they don't even have the right people in those leadership positions. There is no effective channel of communications established. There is no accountability. With effective leadership, this could be an extremely profitable company. What you know doesn't matter at Acronis but rather who you know.

Review Title: Company that cares about their employees and values great talent
Pros:
- Solid higher management
- Reputable CEO with a good track record and great work ethic
- Laser focus on what company does the best and expansion of growing markets  
- Provide great opportunities to people as they did to me
Cons: - Management has been changed quite frequently for the last 5 years which lead to loss of many talented people

Pros: in a small team, there is a decent amount of collaboration,  we used recent software, so no limping along with old stuff.
Cons: Too many C-Level executives, Acronis will fire the people doing the work, bring in some big exec from Microsoft and they bring in contractors who do nothing but run up big bills.  The people who have been there the longest are the first to get pushed out.  Massive changeover in strategy and management every 3 months.  Employee's who couldn't hack it under the pressure and leave are brought back as high paid contractors who enact revenge against the people who outperformed them the first time around.

Pros: I have worked at Acronis for 8 months now and I have learned so much, also it's right off the highway surrounded by great places to eat during lunch! It is a good work environment with great amenities like snacks and games. Everyone is very supportive of each other and kind. The culture of the company is growing, I see people more social now, with people regularly catching up for happy hour after work and meeting up in the weekend.
Cons: No 401k match, but they are working on it

Pros: I have been employed for 2 years and have been very happy here.  I work in the Burlington office and enjoy the small company feel and the ability to work from home.  I finally found a company that does not micromanage me in my role.  Hard work is appreciated.  They have done a lot of investing in taking care of their employees over the last year.  I really enjoy the layed back culture and happy to hear that they will institute pay raises on a regular basis based on performance..
Cons: I miss the monthly lunches.  :-)

Pros: I have been with Acronis for 2 months, and I have a good feel for company culture now. Under the new leadership there is an abundance of positive change with the business direction. The new leadership understands what is needed to move forward and expand, while not ignoring the business that has made them successful for the last decade.
Cons: There is still a lot of work to be done, which means long hours, but the work is rewarding and team-oriented.

Review Title: Smartest people I have ever worked with
Pros: Great people.  Huge opportunity.  Indoor parking.  Well stocked snack room.  Inclusive in decision making.  Great IT staff.  Clear vision for the company.  Very international in attitude and workforce.  Great products.
Cons: Some policies such as filing expense claims,  are draconian and untrusting.  Some people have been there too long.  A lot of new employees so culture is not stable.

Pros: The momentum is shifting. In the last 6-9 months there have been MAJOR changes in the leadership and strategy for Acronis. All are positive things. The culture is changing and there is a real positivity in the air, despite the ground we still need to cover
Cons: There is A LOT of ground to cover to get things where they need to be

Review Title: A great start to my career
Pros: They give you a chance to break into software.  It's a great place to start your career in software, at least it was when I was there.  Perhaps someone more senior may receive a more aggressive compensation package and it would be a good move.
Cons: Hard on numbers, like most sales organizations, but there was always a coldness to it and no exceptions.

Review Title: Great company to start your career
Pros: Acronis is a results-driven SaaS business with a very high demand for its employees. In exchange, you participate in very rewarding and complex projects that impact the company globally and that helps to advance your career exponentially.
Cons:
- Salary and compensation are below the market for tech companies.
- Unplugging from work is hard as expectations to deliver are very high.
- 401k match is OK but takes few years to vest and fully hit your account.
- Equipment/support not adequate to WFH.

Review Title: Great Place to learn, grow and have impact
Pros: Acronis is in the midst the massive digital transformation movement. Here I get to experiment with new ideas on how to grow the business. Because we are a mid sized company, each person's decisions have a direct impact on the success of the company.
Cons: Acronis is in a fragmented and competitive market. It means that you have to always be alert and ready to respond. I love this environment but not for everyone.

Pros: It is a company that has good potential and good products.  Our current technology is excellent. Customers like our products.  We are moving to a VAR model which is fun to be involved with.
Cons: Exec management here is the pits.  They are way over their heads and it shows.  CEO and sales exec VP are a cartoon. They treat employees like gerbils on a treadmill.  Mid-level management is good but gets little help from the top.  Poor pay and a revolving door for employees. I don't see management making good decisions to grow the company.

Pros: Company had a good CEO and people but everything was changed. New CEO is Russian, company belongs to him and it influences a lot on the way the company works.
Cons: Decisions  are made by small circle of people close to CEO, sometimes not even professionals. Easy to get title which does not mean such experience. CEO and his management changes their mind every day, they are not able to manage their people properly and close projects successfully. There are always limited resources and new management is not able to manage them efficiently.

Review Title: Acronis - fast growing, dynamic and innovative company
Pros:
I have been working with the company for 5 month.
Very professional management, successfully leading the transformation of the company to new and attractive business model.
Great people, very dynamic, tones of innovation and creativity and strong partnerships.
Very bright future.
Cons: Demanding, fast paced, high level of adaptivity required

Review Title: Great Opportunity From the Ground Floor
Pros: Good leadership and couldn't ask for a better team. The sales team in Scottsdale functions very much like a start up. Great software with tremendous growth transitioning from software to cloud. Free food and drinks. Good culture.
Cons: Because it does have a start up feel, sometimes answers can be difficult to find.

The company is in a very strong market. Lots of potential to support future growth.
Great people amazing leadership and a "Never give up" attitude
Cons:
High pace, very demanding.
In order to win the market and grow there is a need to constantly push for more. Celebrate only for a short time and push for the next challenge.

Pros:
- People

- Recruiting Process
Cons:

- No summer Friday's (This would be a huge improvement opportunity)

Pros:
Excellent company /product - superior reputation in the industry -  

Nice base salary

Leads provided for you - no cold calling -

Snacks/meals/luncheons provided often
Cons:
Unfortunately,I have a few items to discuss here.  I really want to like everything about this company, but there are a few areas that must be improved quickly.  

First, the company has sort of a start up feel, since they are regrouping after many years. However policies and procedures are extremely disorganized and subjective. Professionalism is lacking in that sense. Answers are given one day on something, only to be changed the next day.


Also, The base salaries are good, but the quotas are unreasonable, and slightly demotivating in your efforts to reach them. Although you make a decent base salary, it’s rather hard to hit your on target earnings.  Higher payout for commissions is highly recommended, to provide more motivation for the employees. If it means a slightly lower base salary, that is something to consider, but I think the current commission structure is not designed properly for full motivation and commitment.  

The overall management/attitude is not where it needs to be. It’s a very black and white culture, almost like a dictatorship, There’s no fairness when it comes to making decisions on discrepancies that can happen from time to time. They treat you more like objects, then human beings. This is my biggest concern, and I hope this can be addressed quickly. .  Genuine compassion, support, and fair treatment needs to be implemented to really grow this company to the next level.  Just use common sense and treat people how you would like to be treated .

Pros:
good benefits
company is flexible in every aspect if you bring value of course
company is investing in their employees (at least it does for me)
company is result orientated and has a good tech
Cons: mostly QA could be better and inter-company communication is not ideal as well

Review Title: The worst I have ever endured. Very unprofessional and no direction. Get it together Acronis
Pros: Free snacks and  soft drinks
Cons:
Most managers have left ,most account managers have left due to no direction from execs. It’s a skeletal sales floor. Pay is horrible and management  doesn’t have a good way to track won deals. There are constant mistakes on commissions. It’s very unprofessional. I now see that  a lot of their issues were glossed over when I was interviewed  and asked straight forward questions about the job. I guess they did what was necessary to get good workers hired...
I will be leaving shortly because this is not a place of integrity or professionalism.

When the Head of HR and then the Recruiting Manager leave, you know it is bad!

Poor communication. Xerox pay is poor. I was “promoted” to site manager, a hand shake promotion. Meaning given the extra responsibility with no official promotion. I’ve stayed at the same level. They did nothing for my coworker for her 30th work anniversary except for a pin. 30 years, nothing. In 8 years they’ve only removed benefits, not added any. They’ve also put managers on several accounts. Meaning I have 2 managers who I haven’t actually seen in several weeks. If things seem to be going ok, they focus on accounts that are falling apart. My operation manager’s only knowledge about how my account is doing is just what I tell him. There used to be a manager on site most of the time. This keeps people on task better. Also, I could leave this company now and make more money in a lesser position with a lot of other print companies.

Review Title: Xerox Nightmares: My Rollercoaster Ride Through Confusion and Chaos
Pros:
Recruitment Assistance: The company has a recruitment process that helps candidates secure positions even if they haven't applied for specific roles.
Access to Resources: Employees eventually gain access to a van and credit card, which could be beneficial for work-related tasks.
Remote Work Option: There's an option to work from home, providing flexibility in the work environment.
Previous Experience with Xerox Machines: If you have prior experience operating Xerox machines, it could contribute to a smoother transition into the role.
Cons:
Unclear Expectations: Lack of clarity in job expectations and responsibilities, leading to confusion for new employees.
Inadequate Orientation: Insufficient onboarding and orientation process, leaving employees to navigate their roles independently.
Overwhelming Training: The extensive and overwhelming online training, particularly on outdated printers, may not align with the company's future direction.
Delayed Access to Essential Resources: Obtaining crucial resources like a van and credit card took over a month for some employees.
Additional Costs for Van: The van, initially presented as optional, comes with a mandatory $90 monthly fee for personal use, impacting overall compensation.
Communication Challenges: Difficulty in reaching out to HR and payroll support, leading to frustration in obtaining necessary information.
High Federal Taxes: Employees reported unusually high federal taxes, contributing to dissatisfaction with overall compensation.
Limited Managerial Support: Challenges in receiving timely and helpful responses from management, impacting the overall support system.

Cons: Slow work processes, outdated products

Pros: I guess there's job security, considering how many people voluntary leave this position so quickly.
Cons:
The pay is mediocre, the schedule is absolutely atrocious - it is rotating day/night schedule, which rotates EVERY WEEK, literally the worst frequency for such a drastic rotation. Additionally, despite working 48 hours per week every week, management was able to manipulate the schedule in such a way where half the weeks worked would yield no overtime (half of the weeks would be 48 hours, the other half 36). They absolutely knew what they were doing. It's even worse considering how high the profit margins are (or at least were) on this product. Obviously, they don't care at all about their employees in the slightest.

Then there's many employees themselves. When I was there, the toner specialists were almost completely divided into two groups (with rare exception) - kids just getting out of college with no prior full time work experience, and old disgruntled laid off Kodak employees. The former group was what I was part of, and consisted of a lot of good people. The latter was much more problematic. While some of the older workers were fine, many were unbelievably nasty. Racism, homophobia, and sexism ran rampant to a degree that I have never seen at any other job. I worked at L3Harris after this - I am not exaggerating when I say that many of these guys would've been walked out the door within weeks of being hired there. But the Xerox toner plant not only tolerated it - they promoted many of these guys. When people say that Xerox hasn't adapted to the 21st century, they mean it in every possible way.

Pros: Decent Benefits, that’s about it.
Cons: Low compensation, void of any culture, toxic environment, limited opportunity. I worked for Xerox for over a decade, and when I approached management about compensation and was told raises weren’t possible, they turned around and hired multiple people with starting salaries higher than my own. This was the catalyst for giving notice, which was met with nothing more than contempt from management, as my departure inconvenienced them. I’ve had stellar reviews my entire time with company, and served multiple roles beyond the scope of my job when the account struggled. Despite this, my last days with Xerox did not include a single thank you for my service throughout the years, and I was ushered out the door like the outgoing mail. It’s difficult to even articulate what a disgusting, toxic culture this company embraces for the sake of pinching pennies, but I wouldn’t recommend working there to my worst enemy.

Review Title: Employees Are Exploited Through "House Takes All" Payrate Policy
Pros: It's a comfortable, relatively friendly environment. I never had a problem with the staff, and the place is kept clean and pleasant to work in.
Cons: The pay system is based heavily off of reviews, and one bad review from one irate customer is all it takes to dock your pay 3-4$ an hour for a stupidly long time. At least a month or more. There was never any hope of meeting the impossible standards they set, since one irate, entitled customer was all it took to lose the closest thing they had to decent pay. Even their "best pay" was a meager amount that barely made it worth coming in. And don't even talk about the benefits, because what they offer is a joke in terms of medical/dental. You're basically working just to pay your premium if you take them... or your deductibles, out-of-pocket, etc.

Review Title: Low pay, HR and management oversight largely absent in USA
Pros: - Access to large training libraries and live certification training. - Lots of remote work possibilities if you're interested in that. - Professional attitudes during meetings and townhalls. - Benefits package in USA is reasonable.
Cons: - Training library is largely out-of-date - If you land a contract in a different region or country, company will not help with relocation costs at all. - Lack of direction from all levels of management. - Coforge has barely any management presence in the USA. - It's largely up to you to self-recruit and find yourself the next contract. - Acquisition teams are mostly not up-to-date with current tech/programming skill requirements and are easily confused by technical talk. - No pay raises in the 3 years I was there. - Low pay. You're not paid based on your qualifications. - Big push to apply for jobs you knowingly aren't qualified for. - No office space...in 3 years I never went to an office nor was I given any form of company id or badge. - Lots of live training offered, but most of it will be off-limits to you due to Coforge "verticals" structure. - Business units within Coforge seem to be in competition with each other instead of working together. - You will have nobody in management here to advocate for YOU. It's important that you realize you are on your own, nobody will give you any direction on training or career improvement or job placement. You are on your own. - Still relying on old contracts, very little effort to find new clients in the big metro areas like Atlanta, GA.

Review Title: Boa empresa para trabalhar e crescer

Cons: Um contra que é um ponto positivo dependendo da perspetiva, é que por a empresa ter sede no BR, os contratos são CLT, apesar de trabalhar como extensão dos clientes (no qual boa parte é dos EUA), desta forma a remuneração é um pouco acima da média brasileira, mas não tão acima, devido aos custos da CLT, bem como a forma da Encora trabalhar, que é mantendo um relacionamento de longo prazo com seus funcionários, ou seja, mesmo que o cliente encerre o contrato, a Encora realoca todos, independente do tamanho da equipe, mesmo que tenha que manter alguns funcionários, durante este período sem tá sendo pago por nenhum cliente, o que é um benefício tanto pra Encora quanto para seus funcionários.

Review Title: Used to be great now it's just another offshore company
Pros: When it was Nearsoft Inc., there was a lot to do as we had almost no organizational structure or processes, trying to have as little bureaucracy as possible. With a startup's fast pace, there was a lot to do and create, but we felt cared for and treated as people. We wouldn't say we were like a family, however, we called ourselves a "tribe".
Cons:
After being acquired and joining Encora Inc., there is the feeling of slowly becoming another global offshore company. Policies are being created fast and with lots of effort, but they probably fall short as more people need to be involved in this critical project. 
Compliance training is very generic, and dull, with old repetitive information and unfortunately, cultural nuances are not usually considered in the company.
The company seems to try to complete a checklist of very important topics that every global company should follow, but some of those topics (like DEI) feel rushed in and not sincere, except only for the initiatives created by the employees. 

In Mexico, specifically, communication from top to bottom is not good at all, promises were made and were not respected (gympass and salary reviews in 2022), and the big problem here is that we only realized that they were not gonna happen because people started to ask what was going on. Information definitely comes late from the direction.

Review Title: Not a great time to work at Zebra
Pros:
Exceptional benefits and perks
Good salary
Interesting clients and super helpful products with a great reputation
Reasonable, though not exactly generous, PTO
Cons:
Business trajectory is highly uncertain, given the number of T1 retailers either going under or slashing spend. 
-Zebra execs may not want to admit it, but the company clearly spent recklessly during the pandemic and the bloat has never been more obvious than in recent months
-Work-life balance is something many employees have only ever heard of
-Jaw-dropping, disturbing, and infuriating amounts of favoritism and nepotism, especially when it comes to promotions and career advancement
-If you’re hired as a specialist, be prepared to remain one for a LONG time. Management promotions are far and few between, and the rare opptys that do become available often go to the hiring managers’ buddies. Sabotaging/undermining qualified employees to clear the way for friends is definitely not unheard of…
-Questionable accountability, as leaders of consistently underperforming teams rarely seem to face any consequences or executive intervention (again, could also speak to favoritism)
-Layoffs have left a wake of paranoia, grief and confusion that is still lingering
-Slipping morale - never seems to be any genuinely good news coming from C-level, only (slightly) silver-lined clouds
-Some teams (or entire divisions) are incredibly cliquey, especially post-acquisitions, and make it very difficult to fit in. My division was once a great, welcoming, fun, inclusive place to work — until we inherited a large number of employees from an acquisition. The acquired product quickly became a top revenue generator, and as a result, all employees who’d come from that acquisition were held in the highest regard (to the point of pampering). Eventually the blatant double standards, chauvinism, entitlement, favoritism, and other unprofessional behaviors while leadership literally sat back and watched turned the environment toxic

Review Title: Incredible Place to Thrive and Innovate
Pros: Innovation-Driven Culture: Zebra truly is at the forefront of technology innovation in the field of asset intelligence and tracking. They continually invest in research and development to remain ahead of the curve, which in turn provides opportunities for employees to work on cutting-edge technologies and contribute meaningfully to their development. Employee Growth & Development: There is a strong emphasis on professional development, and I've had numerous opportunities for career growth. The management is supportive of lateral and vertical movement, which allows for exploring various roles and responsibilities. Work-Life Balance: Despite being a fast-paced tech company, Zebra maintains a strong commitment to work-life balance. Flexible hours and the option to work from home (when feasible) has allowed me to maintain a healthy balance between my personal life and work. Team & Leadership: The teamwork at Zebra is something to be admired. There's a sense of unity and mutual respect amongst employees, and the leadership is transparent, approachable, and receptive to ideas. This supportive atmosphere allows for innovative ideas to flourish and helps in personal and professional growth.
Cons: Compensation - The pay range for this role is undervalued by Zebra

Review Title: Twelve years gone in an instant.
Pros: Pay and bennies were decent. Teammates were ride or die. Some managers truly had your back. I genuienly liked working with the customers I had. Despite being a revolving door, Sales was generally helpful as well.
Cons:
If there was a drinking game where the rule was to take a shot every time Leadership said the word "Cloud" on an all-hands, you would be hospitalized with alcohol poisoning in less than an hour. 

This company is on the way to becoming a proxy billing service for Microsoft. They do not have their own cloud infrastructure. It all goes through Azure. When Microsoft changes the rules, they have absolutely no control over it or say in it. 

If I ever hear someone use the term "Customer Delight" unironically again, I'm going to throw up. All they care about is numbers. Making customers happy means nothing. Some SVP or Director logs into PowerBI while they drink their coffee, and if the board isn't completely green, the managers get a nastygram. It's a call center. 

"Hey, I know this isn't your product, but I need you to take this four day training with broken labs and then immediately start taking cases. No, there isn't any extra compensation for this. Have you taken any cases yet?"

I'd hope to spend another ten years at this place. I was content with what I did, and I felt no need to climb any corporate ladders. I'd have been happy to retire. If the product I invested a decade of my life into hadn't been left to rot in hospice, it may have happened. As it were, it ended with no warning on an otherwise regular day.

My customers gave me a warmer sendoff than my manager did. That should tell you all you need to know. 

The only thing that truly matters to leaderships is making money for the VC firm that overpaid for the brand back in 2015.

All other priorities are rescinded. 

Crew expendable.

Review Title: In it for the long haul but with a huge asterisk
Pros:
Deep Appreciation: Employees hold a profound appreciation for Veritas and find inspiration in its positive culture.

Commitment to Success: Despite concerns, there is a strong commitment to Veritas' long-term success, driven by a genuine belief in the superiority of the product.

Resourceful Management: Direct managers are wholeheartedly dedicated to ensuring employees have the necessary resources for success, setting commendable examples of true leadership.

Opportunities for Improvement: The recognition of areas needing improvement, such as fostering diversity and enhancing resources, indicates a proactive approach to organizational growth.

Optimism for Continuous Improvement: Despite challenges, there is an optimistic outlook for continuous improvement in organizational culture and leadership, fostering a workplace employees can be proud of.
Cons:
Leadership Misalignment: Concerns about the alignment between the Veritas Leadership Team's capabilities and Carlyle's objectives raise questions about the organization's ability to navigate challenges and achieve long-term success.

Recurring Downsizing: Frequent Reductions in Force (RIFs) indicate potential issues in the overarching strategy and leadership decisions, creating uncertainty about stability and sustainability.

Diversity Gaps: Identified gaps in fostering diversity, particularly at higher levels, highlight areas that require immediate attention and rectification.

Short-Term Vision Challenges: Short-term vision and goals set by current ownership are perceived as obstacles to the realization of a comprehensive long-term vision for Veritas.

Perceived Legacy Image: Despite having a well-endowed marketing team, Veritas is perceived as a legacy entity, prompting suggestions for a strategic reallocation of marketing funds to reshape its image.

Compensation Alignment Concerns: Concerns about the alignment of compensation structures within WSM and uncertainties surrounding the transition of the Customer Success Organization raise questions about incentivizing desired behaviors and outcomes associated with customer success.

Resource Enhancement Opportunities: While essential tools are available, there is an acknowledged opportunity for improvement in resources, emphasizing the potential for increased efficiency and elevated performance.

Industry Perception: Veritas' perception as a legacy entity may impact its appeal, necessitating strategic initiatives to engage with the next generation of IT leaders and remain relevant in the dynamic industry landscape.

Pros: Great brand, strong in Large Enterprise & Public Sector
Cons: Total bait & switch; and a career mistake I was recruited away from a role that I was just coming into my own; with the glitz and glamour of a brand new role, with global responsibilies. Day 1, SVP who created role and hired me, told me he moved to a new role in the company. Day 1, started working for different SVP, who had no idea who I was or why I was there. Over the first 10 months, my small squad was rolled under 5 different Senior Leaders in the company. At the end of 1 year, I was finally working for someone who was interested in my success... ...and then the economic downturn; and I was offered a package to leave. I determined that at best I was offered a Path to Mediocrity. I took the package and left. I still have good friends and former colleagues there at Veritas; but it was a mistake for me.

Pros: Innovative Work Environment: Veritas Technologies fosters an innovative and dynamic work environment. The company encourages employees to explore new ideas, experiment with cutting-edge technologies, and contribute to groundbreaking solutions in the data management and protection industry. Professional Growth: Veritas places a strong emphasis on employee development. The company offers various learning and training opportunities, enabling employees to enhance their skills, expand their knowledge, and advance in their careers. This commitment to growth is particularly beneficial for those looking to progress within the tech industry. Collaborative Culture: Collaboration is at the heart of Veritas' culture. Teams work closely together, valuing input from diverse perspectives. The emphasis on teamwork promotes a sense of camaraderie among employees, leading to increased creativity and problem-solving capabilities. Impactful Work: Veritas operates in a space crucial for modern businesses - data management and protection. Working here means contributing to solutions that help organizations safeguard their valuable data, ensuring business continuity and compliance. This sense of purpose can be incredibly fulfilling. Work-Life Balance: Veritas acknowledges the importance of work-life balance. The company offers flexible work arrangements, which can be especially beneficial for maintaining a healthy equilibrium between professional and personal responsibilities.
Cons: High Expectations: Due to the nature of the tech industry and the company's focus on innovation, there might be high expectations regarding performance and deliverables. This can occasionally lead to increased pressure and tight deadlines. Fast-Paced Environment: While some thrive in a fast-paced environment, others might find it challenging to keep up with the rapid changes and evolving projects at Veritas. This pace could potentially lead to increased stress levels for some employees. Communication Challenges: In larger organizations like Veritas, effective communication can sometimes be a challenge. Clear communication across teams and departments is crucial to ensure that everyone is aligned and working towards the same goals.

Review Title: One of the best Organisation to work with
Pros: • Veritas is one of those Organizations which have a customer as well as an employee-centric approach. • The work culture in Veritas is great and in a world where employees switch their jobs very frequently because they want career growth and good packages, Veritas has a good number of employees who are working here for more than 10 years for the same reason. • Employees are valued and empowered. • Veritas offers very good perks, bonuses, and rewards. • You get can claim yearly wellness, dental, and health screening amounts. • They give one of the best transport facilities for employees (Home pickup and Drop) too. • The crowd is very sophisticated, and you can actually learn from each individual that you meet here.
Cons: If you are a great leader or if you're working under a great leader, there are no cons.

Review Title: Never fully pays you your full compensation package
Pros: For the most part, good people. It's nice how you can see your impact at this company as an individual contributor.
Cons: I worked here for three years and was never fully paid what I was provided as my comp package. The first year, they furloughed us during the pandemic for multiple weeks and told us not to tell anyone about it. The second year, they cut out their 401k match for the entire year, and the third year we magically didn't meet our goals as a company, so we didn't get our full bonus payout. This place is a good 'quick stop' in your career to get some experience and move on to something better in the tech space.

Review Title: Culture, leadership, and processes were dysfunctional, disorganized, and antiquated
Pros: Salary is competitive, which isn't saying much in this climate.
Cons:
TLDR; Culture, leadership, and processes were so dysfunctional, disorganized, and antiquated.

 Leadership: VP Level was condescending, arrogant, and consistently made others feel inferior. Director level leadership - absent/unavailable. When it came to direction/vision/goals, very hands off and vague, not great people management. 

 Culture: antiquated/outdated, just like the products they offer. While HR has all the necessary practices in place to keep up to save face, the culture provided by leadership and long time employees feels disconnected and frankly depressing. A lot of my initial meetings with colleagues were spent hearing them air out their grievances.

Processes: never been part of a company that moves more slowly to get things done in product and development. Communication between the two are incredibly disjointed due to old school practices and lack of formal process.

If you're looking for a modern software/product company who practices agile methodology and delivers on consistent, shorter, intervals with good team collaboration and communication, you'll be left sorely disappointed.

Review Title: Great place to work, could improve on technology and efficiency
Pros: I can honestly say this is the best place I've worked in terms of the culture and workplace environment. I've never been surrounded by a group so genuinely kind and supportive. Great work-life balance as well

It could seem like they aren't as fast growing/scaling as other tech companies, but they are evolving and their focus is on quality over quantity.

Review Title: Typical soulless multinational company with lower pay than the competition
Pros:
- Full Home Office if you live more than Xkm away from the office
- Company sponsored certifications such as ITIL V4 Foundation and Comptia A+ after a year with the company
- Private healthcare after 1 year with the company
- You might get a role in your team which is not monitored closely (or at all) and you get away with doing the bare minimum (due to bad management)
Cons:
- Much lower salary compared to the competition in Budapest
- Raises are only a point of discussion if you are trying to leave the company, otherwise don't even dream
- Workload can be a lot depending on the account you are supporting
- No feedback = Good feedback
- Seniors with several years of experience earn the same or (in my case) less, than people who join the company today
- Useless internal trainings that they push a lot
- Typical pointless Workday goal setting every once in a while
- You only get different positions if you befriend your current leaders, or threaten to leave after being with them for a couple of years

Pros: It can be an excellent place to rapidly level up your IT skills before moving on to a real workplace, as long as you leave within the 12-18 month escape window before your soul exits your body.
Cons:
Inability to reward any effort whatsoever other than with additional non-renumerated responsibilities.

Recognition is pathetic to the point of absurd hilarity, often involving spam e-cards of no monetary value whatsoever!

Expect to be a jack-of-all-trades, to "wing-it" until you can convince yourself you're a subject matter expert enough to convince your clients.

Employee benefits quite literally consist of one single item; which is a solid EPA partner; ironically the only reason you really need the EPA is for them to counsel you on the trauma of your employment.

The company needs a massive thought-overhaul, and as it's refusing to do it voluntarily, it will happen through external forces (such as major partners looking elsewhere)

Review Title: Work long and hard and you shall not be rewarded, maybe one day in the distant future.
Pros:
Interesting Industry to work in.
Qtr over Qtr record profits and performance
Cons:
Here we are in 2024 and it has just been announced that 2023 Merit will finally happen, i.e. In January 2024 merit payout based on 2022 performance

Benefits - get worse every year, smoke and mirrors, sleight of hand.   At a couple months away from 5 years of service earning an additional week of vacation the policy changes.  To get back to that same level of vacation now requires 10 years of service.   The extra week of vacation employees would have earned has been repackaged as sick days.  Those with the 5+  year tenure keep the extra weeks vacation AND  have sick days available.  We could care less about the sick days, those are for people that may abuse time off.  Give employees what they signed up for and have earned without changing the target.

Review Title: It used to be the best place to work. Not anymore.
Pros: Exposure to multiple tasks. Exposure to Innovation.
Cons:
The current management is having the absolute "service base" culture. Even they have started comparing salary structure with the Infosys and Wipro.

Earlier management was so dependable that if you trust them and give them time, they would never let you down.

Not the whole culture is screwed. I had a manager who was fighting with me on a scrum call and trying to push me to accept that the "primary key is not unique". When I used to discuss time and space complexity, he used to ask me why are you helping others with the interview questions. 

Now a days favoritism is at its peak. If you have a long tongue you will get all the opportunities/promotion/hike. If you have morals and self respect, you will be discriminated.

Pros: None. None. None. None. None
Cons: They put people through stack ranking in the yearly appraisal process. It's very in-human. They compare architects with 1 and 2 year people and create what they call stack ranks for a given organization. Obviously the senior people come high in the rank. New people end up being low in the rank because they are less critical to business. Then from that stack rank, they put bottom 15% in PIP. Doesn't matter whether they are bad or not. Then they subject them to in-human torture where they force people to resign through their PIP process. If you are joining this company, do ask HR about the appraisal process and stack rank. Ask them to show the published process on how they employee stack ranking and what rating they give. This is something which is not documented anywhere but they follow. This stack ranking they don't talk about it openly but it is part of their work culture. The managers knows about it but they don't tell their employees on stack ranking and why someone have gone into PIP. It is nothing to do with their performance but their biased way of doing stack ranking and in-human work culture.

Pros: The people here really live up to its name. They are really NICE! You can feel the positivity emanating from each member of the team. I love their camaraderie and team spirit. You feel that they want the best for you. Onsite is two days weekly, which I feel is necessary to maintain the team spirit. The company provides a plethora of learning materials.
Cons: This is nitpicking here, but if they can reduce the number of onsite to just 1 day, that will be great, especially for those who live far away.

Pros:
I like the team that I work with. We're all intertwined and have a great culture to collaborate and work together. The ANZ team has been great in getting me up to speed with all the ANZ norms when I started.
This job has allowed me to help my personal and professional growth. Not every day is the same- which is what I like! It's not boring at all as you're always on the go. Not your typical 9-5.
 It is a fun, challenging yet rewarding experience.
Cons: Timezone differences with meetings can be challenging

Review Title: NICE Ltd: Where Culture, Growth, and Impact Unite in a Dynamic Work Environment
Pros:
After 6 years and counting, I thought it is good time to share my experience at working with Nice. I want to divide this into 3 main categories

1. Culture : This is one of the most important thing I like about NICE. It has vibrant, open and inclusive culture. Be a getting opportunity to try new things, express yourself, respect to each other , openness or politics-free environment, you will never regret being here.
Particularly for my BU, we have Sports days planned throughout year, many cultural events, Coffee with senior directors and offsite every quarter for manager happens without fail. Truly this is something differentiates and bring excitements when we work here.

2. Personal Growth: I have seen rewards and recognition are given for deserving candidates. Everybody is measured by same scale and processes are transparent. There are most people coming from Product companies who has rich experience and you get to learn from them. Increments are above market standards. In NICE, I have not see company firing anyone other than non-performers even in Covid or in slow job markets. So job stability is there.

3. Professional Growth: There are various groups and initiatives for every role and specialization. Be it devOps, Front end, even managers and directors. I have seen very few companies who ran comprehensive 6 month external training programs to managers and directors. This investment shows in skills of people.
Cons: CTC structure could have been better.

Review Title: A Workplace That Blends Professional Growth with Fun and Continuous Improvement!
Pros:
Work Culture [5/5]: The work culture at NICE is a testament to the company's dedication to creating an environment where every employee can thrive. The leadership team specially in WEM actively promotes a positive and inclusive atmosphere, It's not just about completing tasks; it's about enjoying the journey together.

Fun at Work (5/5): At NICE, the mantra is 'no work without fun.' The company understands the importance of a positive and enjoyable work environment. From team-building activities to exciting sports days, there's always something happening to break the routine and create a lively atmosphere.

Regular Leadership Coffee Meets (5/5): One of the unique aspects of working at NICE is the regular coffee meets with leadership. This open and informal setting allows employees to engage with leadership, share ideas, and gain valuable insights. It's a fantastic initiative that promotes transparency and a strong sense of community within the organization.

Training Opportunities (5/5): NICE places a strong emphasis on continuous learning, offering high-quality training programs at all levels. Whether you're a newcomer or a seasoned professional, there are ample opportunities to enhance your skills and stay updated on industry trends.
Cons: No cons as such, NICE Ltd is on a trajectory of success, marked by a dedication to continuous improvement. Acknowledging the dynamics of workload distribution and adapting to them when necessary demonstrates a commitment to sustainable growth. It's clear that the company understands the evolving nature of the industry and is poised to navigate these challenges successfully for the benefit of all employees.

Cons: The team isn't ready to employ. they are just wasting people's time. The Devops Engineer from Contact Engine which Nice just bought and based in the US is very rude and I hope he changes his character as I can't imagine what the people working with are going through.

Pros: Some talented people work there
Cons: NICE is global monstrosity based in Israel focused on purchasing customer experience software companies across America and throughout the world. Once the existing employees are absorbed into the machine, they are treated like cogs in a wheel with little to no value. The executive committee thinks they know everything, and they do not value the experience of experts in their field. Shortly after the mergers, they conduct piece mill layoffs throughout the absorbed companies to avoid having to report the mass layoffs that are the actual goal. The truly talented and those who push back are either forced out or laid off.

Review Title: Not perfect but just nice for me
Pros:
Nice manager, team members that would support each other.
Nice office, good office equipment
Cons: No place is perfect but NICE is just nice for me

Pros:
Helpful co-workers
Zero micromanagement (on my team at least)
Leading CCaaS solution - CXone
Cons: Unfortunately, if you don’t have existing accounts, and if it’s all white space, unless you’re lucky enough the accounts you have are adversary’s. Far too many sales people with few accounts. If you’re in the Premier group, you’re golden. National group, you’re screwed. 90% of my accounts have been worked over for years and are not B2C markets (target market for CXone is B2C). I have a great team & manager. Just real crappy accounts and I’m hearing this from other areas of the business like Key. Premier has so many accounts and oppy’s. Zero Inclusivity every team has entirely diff rules pitting reps against each other. This is a “product run company” not a “sales organization”. So much lack of ownership. Layoffs they try to hide (just had a decent trimming one rep per team let go). Base pay is alright but not when you factor in the healthcare costs/benefits and no RSU’s. RSU’s go to leadership. Makes zero sense. Lack of support. Just a poorly run company overall. Takes a week at times to complete a quote in COQ. There’s almost a million SKU’s from all other LOB’s NICE has acquired. And never cleaned up. They over complicated the messaging and product offering. The company is its own worst enemy. Deawn out, complex sales process. 80% of new business comes from existing base. Unless you have that^ you’ll be set up for failure day one. Also, the SE’s are the own the sales process. It’s completely out of my control. As a seasoned tech seller I’ve never not been able to conduct customer demo’s. It’s bizarre. So once you do that you have to always bring in your SE and many other people from other parts of the company. I swear I spend at least 10 hours a week just getting schedules done internally for customer calls. There are better sales options out there that aren’t as expensive to work for.

Pros:
-Your direct manager and team could be great. Mine are.

-I've only seen two layoffs in my long tenure, and neither was recent. On the down side, they prefer to smoke employees out with blows to morale. I'm not sure if this is true of all locations, but it's a well-defined pattern in the US.
Cons:
-This is an expensive place to work. The pay isn't great, promotions are rare, benefits are poor, and insurance is very costly. You must use your own personal smart device to log in and work, but they offer no device, service, or data reimbursement.

-Employee performance scores are given based more on company politics than employee performance.

-Culture of finger-pointing and extreme micromanagement. Upper management often blames and criticizes without investigating.

-Hybrid work model is rigidly and pettily enforced. We had more flexibility to work remotely as needed before the policy was in place.

Review Title: Incredible Experience so far and Great Culture
Pros: It's been an exhilarating journey as an Agile Coach I can surely say it stands out as a true exemplar of Agility. * Showcasing the true form of building Empowered Teams * Continuous Learning Culture * Collaborative Environment * Innovation Hub * Leadership who Lead by Example Really appreciate the awesome fun activities we've been always having at Nice, whether it's * Impromptu dance-offs by leaders to kick-off the major festivals and events, * The sports day and the warm-up events for the same * Annual days at grand luxury locations * The hilarious Beat the Clock Quiz's themed Fridays, * Coffee meets at The Starbucks or those epic team-building activities It's clear we know how to balance work and play. The positive vibes and laughter not only make the day fly by but also create a fantastic work environment. Overall: * Approachable and very transparent Leadership team * Colleagues with true Collaborative spirit * Rich Agile Culture with different frameworks being used and are timely upscaled to ensure customer satisfaction * Right balance of work and party
Cons: Its been working well soo far, nothing that I can think off

Pros: As NICE leadership is fond of pointing out, the company rarely has reductions in force. There are some great people, as well!
Cons:
While there are great people, and management brags about having no lay offs, the same management will happily drive employees away through insufficient compensation or mismanagement. Many employees make *less* the longer they work due to regular 'merit' increases consistently being below inflation rate.

The product strategy, and its relationship with technical work, is profoundly dysfunctional. If in a technical role, expect to be micro-managed purely to justify management's existence.

If you have a blocking IT issue, don't expect it to get fixed until the issue gets escalated to someone who's a 'Director' or higher.

Pros:
NICE is a company that truly values both personal and professional growth, alongside technical advancement. From day one, I have been immersed in a dynamic and supportive environment that fosters continuous learning and innovation.

One of the standout aspects of this company is its commitment to providing exceptional growth opportunities. The clear career progression paths and well-defined development programs have allowed me to set ambitious goals and chart my own professional journey. Whether it's through mentorship, training workshops, or access to cutting-edge resources, the company invests in its employees' growth, empowering them to reach new heights.

working for this company offers an exceptional work culture that prioritizes employee engagement and holistic well-being. From exciting sports events that bring everyone together to initiatives that support personal and professional growth, they create an environment where you can truly thrive. The opportunity to connect with senior management right from the start through informal coffee meetings further enhances the sense of belonging and understanding within the company. If you're seeking a workplace that values your overall well-being and encourages meaningful connections, this company is the perfect fit.
Cons: Nothing Major as a Cons

Review Title: Don’t touch NICE with a 10 foot poll!
Pros: Nice has the best software in the contact center industry. There are alot of competitors but everyone knows Nice is the best.
Cons: It has been 7ish years since Nice acquired inContact and the Culture now sucks! The Exec Leadership does not care about the employee. They want employee to loyalty but they are not willing do anything extra to get it. The Execs think that driving by the stick will hit numbers where it is actually is doing the opposite. There are good things about Nice but stay far away if you want a company to back you and help you succeed cuz you will not find it here. You will find a company that only wants you to shut up, listen, and follow orders.

Pros: - NICE is a leader in the Contact Center portfolio applications space. - We use the latest cutting edge technology to build customer centric applications. - The leadership is strong and has created a culture of innovation, healthy work environment. The leadership has a clear 5 year vision and ensures that the strategies are shared with all the employees. - There is a focus on organic growth of individuals to leaders in people management, architecture, program management, etc. - We have monthly fun events to foster a culture of camaraderie within our BU. - It is great to see that our Senior management has an open door policy. The coffee meetings with Senior management has given us a candid platform to share ours views and be heard openly.
Cons: - For me, the commute to office and back home is almost 2.5 hours, which eats up a lot of time. However, NICE Flex policy allows me to work in hybrid mode and I have to come to office only twice a week.
